page.title: 05The Health Centre
page.content: 54 people are employed at the Health Centre including doctors, nurses, receptionists, secretaries, health visitors and cleaning staff. Surgeries are held in the morning and afternoon and doctors visit some patients at home. There is always a doctor on call when the centre is closed. Clinics are held for chiropody, audiology, speech therapy and obesity. There are also ante natal clinics and relaxation classes. There are visiting dentists and opticians to treat children under sixteen. Social workers, psychiatric nurses, a clinical psychologist and marriage guidance councillors visit once a week. In the evenings the centre is used by St. John's Ambulance and the Family Planning Clinic.
